vision.notes: Gars possess vision, likely used for prey detection and navigation in aquatic environments. Spotted gars have spots on their head, suggesting visual camouflage or signaling.

mechanoreception.notes: As ray-finned fish, gars likely possess a lateral line system for detecting vibrations and pressure changes in the water. This is crucial for detecting prey and avoiding predators.

chemoreception.notes: Gars likely use chemoreception (taste and smell) to locate prey and assess water quality.
